description.narrative: GGF funds will support SkeenaWild's collaboration with the Wet'suwet'en, Lake Babine, and Gitanyow First Nations to address development proposals and protect biodiversity in their traditional territories. SkeenaWild will work with the Lake Babine Nation to reduce commercial fishing impacts and rebuild the Babine River sockeye and to better understand impacts to salmon from a proposed copper and gold min on Nilkitkwa Lake. Other activities include: assisting Gianyow in stopping or mitigating impacts from the proposed Kerr Sullphurets Mitchell gold/copper mine; assisting Wet'suwet'en Nation in assessing impacts to salmon in the Upper Bulkley watershed from the Equity Silver mine; and providing summaries to Wet'suwet'en leadership on how valued ecosystem components (VECs) have been impacted in their territories since 2008. Additionally, this general support will allow SkeenaWild to have flexibility to work with these First Nations on projects on a timely and efficient basis.
